speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd Singapore. My name is Sarah. How can I help you today?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Hi Sarah, need travel insurance. Quick as possible please, I don't have much time.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I can certainly help you with gathering the details for a quote. Could you tell me where you'll be travelling from?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Singapore, obviously. We're based in Singapore.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Got it, travelling from Singapore. And what is your destination?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Japan.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Japan, noted. And how long will the trip be?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: 10 days. Look, can we speed this up? I just need the standard stuff.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Certainly. To ensure we find the right fit, I need a few more details. How many people will be travelling?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Two of us. We're mostly around 26-40 years old.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, two travellers in the 26-40 age group. Any particular activities planned during the 10 days in Japan?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, we plan to do skiing. Is that covered? Need to know quickly.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, skiing. I've noted that. And regarding medical history, are there any pre-existing conditions for either traveller we should be aware of?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No, no pre-existing conditions. Health is fine. Just need the usual coverage if something happens over there, you know, doctor visits, hospital stays, that kind of thing.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, coverage for emergency medical treatment. And are you taking any special medical equipment with you?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: No special medical equipment needed.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Right. Now, thinking about potential issues, what are your main concerns for this trip?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Look, things go wrong, right? What if we have to cancel last minute because someone gets sick? Need cover for that.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, noted - cover for trip cancellation due to unforeseen illness.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: And flight delays! If the flight back is delayed, what happens? Need cover for extra hotel nights, meals, that stuff. It's a nightmare being stuck.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, coverage for additional expenses due to significant travel delays.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Also, bags. What if the airline loses our luggage or damages it? That needs to be covered.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, coverage for lost or damaged luggage.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, exactly. Oh, and most important actually â€“ I have a cat at home in Singapore. If our return flight is delayed, I need cover for the extra days she'll have to stay in the pet hotel. That's absolutely critical. Can you add that?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, let me note that specific requirement: coverage for additional pet accommodation costs at a kennel or pet hotel in Singapore if your return is unavoidably delayed. Is that correct?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, exactly that. Don't forget it. How much is this all going to cost roughly? Hoping to spend around $400.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: I've noted your budget preference of around $400. So, just to quickly summarise, you need travel insurance for two adults, aged 26-40, travelling from Singapore to Japan for 10 days. You require coverage for trip cancellation, emergency medical expenses, travel delays including compensation for delays, lost or damaged luggage, and specific cover for skiing activities. Additionally, you require cover for additional pet accommodation costs in Singapore if your return is delayed. Is that all correct?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, yes, that's it. Just get me the options quickly, please.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, I have recorded all your requirements. Our quotations team will prepare the relevant options based on these details and will be in touch shortly.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Okay, make it fast. Thanks. Bye.
